p:
Host-rock carbon content has already been measured for hundreds of samples of Paleocene and Cretaceous host rocks offshore Norway
33 , though no comparable data are yet available for UK and Irish parts of the NAIP sill province. The models presented here assume that organic matter is predominantly labile (oil-producing). This choice of organic matter type does not significantly affect the emissions flux results, but it does slightly improve the fit to carbon isotopic records compared with model host rocks with greater proportions of refractory kerogen.
